abstract: BP reports adjusted first-quarter earnings of $2.6 billion, down 20 percent from $3.2 billion one year earlier; Total reports adjusted earnings of $2.6 billion, down 22 percent from year-earlier period; decline is attributed to slumping oil prices.
lead_paragraph: Adjusted earnings fell 20 percent at BP and 22 percent at Total, but results were offset by strong performances in their marketing and refining businesses.

headline.main: BP and Total Report Earnings Declines as Falling Oil Prices Hurt Profits
headline.print_headline: Collapse in Oil Prices Drives Down Profit at BP and Totals

snippet: Adjusted earnings fell 20 percent at BP and 22 percent at Total, but results were offset by strong performances in their marketing and refining businesses.
